title: Pega developer (banking)
description:
Stockholm


Pega developer (banking)



At Capgemini, you’ll have the opportunity to shape your career in a way that suits you, supported by a global community of experts who inspire and empower you. We believe in reimagining what’s possible - using technology to build a more sustainable, inclusive world. Our Financial Services team is at the forefront of this mission. As a reliable partner we guide our customers such as major banks and insurance companies with everything from strategy and planning to implementation and management.


.**Your role**  

  

Working with experienced colleagues, you will assist our customers from early-stage advice to the implementation and integration of the multifaceted platform Pega. Depending on your experience and background, you will have various opportunities and roles in Pega projects. Our projects enhance customer experiences, create customer journeys, and bring them to life with agile teams. We establish new digital platforms and streamline work processes with digital solutions.  

  

*In this position you will play a key role in:*  

  

* Designing and developing Pega applications to automate banking processes.
* Translating business requirements into effective Pega solutions.
* Customizing and configuring Pega systems to meet specific project needs.
* Providing ongoing maintenance and support for existing Pega applications.

  

**Your profile**  

  

* Experience from Pega, either from a position as a developer or system architect.
* Experience in working in an agile and test-driven environment.
* Previous consulting or client service delivery experience.
* One or more certifications in SA, SSA or LSA.
* Proficiency in Swedish is a plus and candidates based in Sweden will be prioritized.
* Experience in financial services or the insurance industry is beneficial.

  

**What we believe you will enjoy about working here**
  

  

* You get to work with major customers within banking and insurance, in exciting and varied roles, giving you the opportunity to develop both personally and professionally.
* The freedom to make decisions, manage your time, and work independently - fostering creativity, innovation, and job satisfaction.
* An extensive benefits package, including parental benefits, occupational and flex pension, private insurance, preventive healthcare, and more.
* A variety of social and wellness activities, from sports and health programs to cultural events and art initiatives, designed to bring employees together and enrich work life.

  

*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification and background checks may occasionally be conducted. More information will be provided if applicable.* *We’re in the midst of the holiday season and we hope you’re having a pleasant end of the year! We’ll start reviewing applications during January and look forward to possibly connecting with you soon!*  

  

#LI-SB1

**About Capgemini**

  

Capgemini is an AI-powered global business and technology transformation partner, delivering tangible business value. We imagine the future of organizations and make it real with AI, technology and people. With our strong heritage of nearly 60 years, we are a responsible and diverse group of 420,000 team members in more than 50 countries. We deliver end-to-end services and solutions with our deep industry expertise and strong partner ecosystem, leveraging our capabilities across strategy, technology, design, engineering and business operations. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.

 **Make it real |** **www.capgemini.com**

title: Senior Business Developer till Euro Accident
description:
Driv utveckling som stärker vår skadeaffär i hela Skandinavien

**Euro** **Accident****Claims** **befinner sig i en spännande fas i sin utvecklingsresa; vi är mitt en stor satsning på digitalisering och processutveckling inom skadeverksamheten mest väsentliga områden för de kommande åren. Vår skadeorganisation spelar en avgörande roll för kundnöjdheten och bolagets fortsatta tillväxt – och nu söker vi dig som vill vara en nyckelperson i att driva vår transformationsresa framåt och bidra till ökad genomförandekraft och fortsatt framgång.**


Försäkringar och hälsa är en vinnande kombination! Genom tidiga insatser, samarbete med kompetenta partners och smarta digitala tjänster har vi på Euro Accident fått saker att hända. Med vårt erbjudande har försäkring gått från att bara vara ekonomisk ersättning till att bidra till livskvalitet och Hållbara medarbetare. Idag har nästan en halv miljon människor trygghet genom oss. Vi är stolta över våra nöjda kunder, vårt goda rykte och den insats vi gör för samhället. Nu avancerar vi för att kunna hjälpa ännu fler och söker dig som vill vara med på vår fortsatta framgångsresa.

### **Om rollen**


Som Senior Business Developer inom Business Development Claims får du en central roll i att driva större utvecklings- och transformationsprojekt inom vår skadeorganisation i hela Skandinavien. Arbetet spänner över våra skadeprocesser inom försäkring, vård, hälsa och rehabilitering – områden där vi har höga ambitioner och stor förändringstakt.


Du fungerar som projektledare för komplexa initiativ, där du:

* tar fram projektmål och tydliga planer
* driver arbetet framåt, skapar engagemang och håller ihop helheten
* hanterar intressenter och säkerställer att projekt levererar mot uppsatta mål
* följer upp, dokumenterar och håller ordning på projektens alla delar
* bidrar aktivt till problemlösning och utveckling av nya arbetssätt
* stöttar organisationen i att implementera och förankra förändringar på ett hållbart sätt.


Arbetet utvecklas över tid – i takt med att våra behov, vår projektmodell och vår skandinaviska samverkan växer. Här får du vara med och forma framtidens arbetssätt inom en affär som är i stark förändring.


Du ingår i ett team med verksamhetsutvecklare med projektledar- och sjuksköterskekompetens, som arbetar nära våra skadeavdelningar i Sverige, Norge och Danmark. Placeringsort är **Stockholm, Växjö eller Oslo**. Resor inom Sverige och till våra nordiska kontor förekommer.

### **Vem är du?**


Vi söker dig som är en skicklig verksamhetsutvecklare och projektledare, med dokumenterad erfarenhet av att driva komplexa projekt och förändringsinitiativ gärna med fokus på digitalisering. Du trivs i gränslandet mellan analys, struktur, kravställning och praktiskt genomförande – och du har lätt att få med dig andra i förändring.

**Du har:**

* minst 7–10 års erfarenhet av verksamhetsutveckling och projektledning, gärna från komplexa miljöer
* akademisk utbildning, gärna civilingenjör eller civilekonom
* mycket god förmåga att kommunicera på svenska och engelska, skriftligt och muntligt
* god analytisk förmåga och lätt att skapa tydliga beslutsunderlag
* vana av att arbeta i Office-paketet och att utveckla verktyg, mallar och arbetssätt som andra använder

**Det är meriterande om du har:**

* erfarenhet som managementkonsult
* drivit större digitaliseringsprojekt
* kunskap om Lean eller agila arbetssätt
* erfarenhet från försäkring eller hälso-/sjukvårdsområdet
* erfarenhet av processkartläggningsverktyg


Som person är du samarbetsorienterad och trygg i att leda andra i förändring. Du är kommunikativ, tydlig och van vid att skapa förankring. Du är också handlingskraftig och lösningsorienterad när situationen kräver det. Du delar självklart våra värderingar: omtanke, handlingskraft och nytänkade - vår kompass i vardagen.  

  

På Euro Accident är det vi medarbetare som bygger framgång. Personliga egenskaper och förmågor är alltid en viktig komponent när vi söker nya medarbetare.

### **Vi erbjuder dig**


När vi bidrar till en trygg och frisk värld börjar vi på våra egna kontor. Vi vill att du ska få och välja en sund balans mellan arbete och privatliv och vi värnar om arbetsglädjen och vår unika kultur där omtanke, handlingskraft och nytänkande är våra ledord i vardagen. Vi erbjuder förmånlig tjänstepension, sjuk- och sjukvårdsförsäkring samt ett generöst friskvårdsbidrag och möjlighet till hybridarbete. Med vår EA-spirit håller vi kulturen och gemenskapen levande genom olika sociala aktiviteter, som gemensamma frukostar, afterworks och föreläsningar med tema hälsa och välmående.  

  

Du välkomnas till något av våra trivsamma kontor i Stockholm, Växjö eller Oslo  

  

Start enligt överenskommelse. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid.

### **Välkommen med din ansökan**


Om du har frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta ansvarig chef Anna Rinneby enligt kontaktuppgifterna nedan. Vi är på julledighet och ser fram emot att läsa din ansökan samt besvara eventuellt frågor när vi är tillbaka efter 7e januari. Efter detta sker urval löpande, så vänta inte med din ansökan.  



  

För en mer rättvis och objektiv urvalsprocess använder vi arbetspsykologiska tester tidigt i processen och ber dig att svara på våra urvalsfrågor i stället för att bifoga ett personligt brev.  

  

Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomför vi bakgrundskontroller av våra slutkandidater före anställningsbeslut.  

  

*Vänligen notera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via mejl med anledning av GDPR.*

title: .NET fullstack utvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Jobbeskrivning**  

C# .NET, React och Redux.


Var med och skapa en bra mjukvaruarkitektur och DevOps med Azure.


Arbeta i en Scrum-miljö.


Samarbeta nära med andra ingenjörer.


Erfarenhet från tvärfunktionella samarbeten.  

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 29-12-2025

 **Om Oss**  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.


Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?  

  

*Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
*MSAB is a global leader in digital forensic technology for mobile device examination and analysis. The MSAB vision is to empower every investigation with digital forensic solutions – for a safer world. A core value is to run an ethics-driven company with innovation and results. The sole focus of MSAB is on delivering high quality digital forensic solutions to collect, review, analyze and manage data. MSAB is a trusted partner to Law Enforcement, Defence Forces, Government Agencies and Forensic Laboratories in democratic countries throughout the world enabling them to investigate crime, gather intelligence, investigate fraud and fight corruption.*

**Now MSAB** are hiring a Fullstack Developer who is a teamplayer, skilled at writing clean and efficient code. Code that contributes to fight crime and protect democracy around the world. An inspiring task!

**The job**


This position is all about building slick, scalable high performance analytic processes from the ground up. You will focus on speed and correctness working in a team of skilled developers. The role is broad but some examples of what we work on are building a cloud based scalable distributed system, front to back. You will be part of developing high performance solutions in a cross platform environment.

  

Our **UniCore Technology (UCT)** team is all about helping our users to make the most sense out of the vast amount of data contained in devices of today.

**You will benefit** from your skills in C++, C# and React in both Windows and Linux environment. This is a job where the technical challenges continuously changes and tickles your innovative mindset.

  

If you have an understanding how high performance technology benefits our clients goals, are curious and loves problem solving. Then it sounds like a good fit.


And if you are a person who are generous with sharing your knowledge, listens to others ideas and understands that together is where we create greatness.


Then we want to have a talk with you!

  

There is much more to talk about, like values, our growth plans, technology choices etc., but we save that for the interview.

  

Welcome to apply now!

  

For more information about MSAB, please visit: http://www.msab.com safer world with us!


As one of the world’s leading digital forensics companies, MSAB leads the way in pioneering advancements that contribute to making our world safer.


Your work at MSAB will bridge the gap between technology and justice. You will be inspired to go beyond your comfort zone, and you will deal with challenging and meaningful projects. When you join us, you become part of a global team that aspires to create a safer digital future, one breakthrough at a time.


We can offer you an exciting work environment, where we value being innovative, acting ethically and delivering results in everything we do while our customers' needs are at the center. We are proud to be a fast-growing international company with more than 20+ nationalities and we work with things that really make a difference.


Every day at MSAB is an opportunity to redefine the future of digital forensics.

### **Are you up for the challenge?**

title: .NET utvecklare
description:
**Att jobba som .NET utvecklare**


Som .NET-utvecklare i vårt Piteå team får du chansen att arbeta med en viktig och samhällsnyttig uppgift, utveckla bankens systemstöd för AML-processer (Anti Money Laundering). Det innebär att du är med och skyddar banken mot ekonomisk brottslighet genom lösningar som bland annat möjliggör transaktionsövervakning och hantering av obestånd. Kort sagt kommer du bidra till att vi gör rätt saker, på rätt sätt.


Teamet du kommer tillhöra är ett erfaret och sammansvetsad grupp bestående av åtta kollegor med kompetens som utvecklare, Scrum Master, PO, systemansvarig och mjukvaruarkitekt. Vi jobbar agilt, värdesätter kunskapsdelning, och arbetar nära både verksamhet och andra IT-team. Du får möjlighet att jobba med teknik i framkant och vara med och påverka både arbetssätt och tekniska vägval.


Vi arbetar hybrid vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. I rollen kommer du att rapportera till gruppchef IT Bankgemensamt.

**För att lyckas i rollen**


Vi tror att du är en person som är nyfiken, ansvarstagande och noggrann. Du tycker om att arbeta strukturerat, är van att samarbeta över teamgränser och trivs när du får kombinera teknik med affärsnytta. Eftersom du kommer att arbeta med komplexa system och ha dialog med både IT och verksamhet, är det viktigt att du även är kommunikativ och lösningsorienterad.


För att lyckas i rollen behöver du ha några års erfarenhet av utveckling i C# och .NET. Du har jobbat med verktyg som Azure DevOps, Octopus Deploy och Git. Då du samarbetar med både interna och externa parter, krävs det att du kan uttrycka dig obehindrat på svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av React och TypeScript samt om du arbetat med testautomatisering. Allt detta hjälper oss att bygga hållbara och moderna lösningar med hög kvalitet.


Vi har dessutom påbörjat vår resa med GitHub Copilot och ser det som en självklarhet att du vill ligga i framkant inom AI-stödd systemutveckling.

**Vad händer nu?**


Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet.


Läs mer om hela vår rekryteringsprocess här.


Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Sverre Sverredal på sverre.sverredal@skandia.se.


Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocess, vänligen ta kontakt med Talent Acquisition Partner Harald Brehmer på harald.brehmer@skandia.se. #LI-HB


Vi kommer att återkoppla till alla som söker oavsett om du går vidare eller inte.

*Nu går vi på lite ledighet och vi kommer inleda urvalsprocessen när vi är tillbaka i januari*.


Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

**Mer om IT**


Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!


Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.


Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Senior Node Developer
description:
### **Who we are**


At Anyfin, we believe in simplicity, transparency, and fairness. We’re the fintech on a mission to challenge the status quo, lowering interest rates, removing unnecessary fees, and helping people take control of their finances.


With more than a million app downloads and presence in Sweden, Norway, Finland, and Germany, we’ve already helped hundreds of thousands of people save money and feel more financially empowered.


We recently obtained our banking license, opening up an entirely new world of opportunities to provide more value to our customers, build even smarter products, scale our technology, and expand into new markets. This next chapter comes with exciting technical challenges — and we’re looking for someone who’s eager to take them on.

### **What you will be doing**


Now we’re looking for a **Senior Node.js Developer** to join our engineering team in Stockholm. This is a role for someone who wants to take ownership, solve complex backend challenges, and contribute directly to the future of our financial platforms.

* Build, optimize and scale robust financial backend systems using Node.js and SQL (Postgres).
* Work primarily in the backend, but also touch on TypeScript, GraphQL and occasionally React.
* Tackle complex coding problems, design new solutions, and refine existing systems.
* Contribute to system architecture, ensuring scalability and reliability of our financial systems as well as championing best practices and continuous learning.
* Help drive improvements across our codebase, processes, and product, bringing that startup mindset where you take initiative, move fast, and get things done.
* Balance speed with quality, because we care about building things that last and seeing our work make a real difference for our users.

### **About you**

* Strong background in backend development with Node.js and SQL databases (preferably Postgres).
* At least 5 years of professional experience, ideally in high-stakes environments like finance.
* Passionate about solving complex backend problems with clean, pragmatic solutions.
* Solid understanding of system design and architecture.
* Bonus if you’ve worked with React, Python, Go, GraphQL, Kubernetes, Google Cloud, or DevOps with Github Actions – but your backend expertise is what matters most.

### **What we offer**


A meaningful role where your work directly impacts how people experience and manage their finances.


The chance to work alongside talented engineers, product managers, and designers with real influence on the product direction.


A culture built on authenticity, ownership, transparency, and having fun while doing impactful work.

### **Why Anyfin?**


At Anyfin, you’ll find a team driven by purpose, curiosity, and a shared ambition to make a difference. We promise a challenging and rewarding journey that will sharpen your skills, expand your creativity, and allow you to work on meaningful projects. Plus, enjoy the benefits of a centrally-located Stockholm office, competitive compensation, extra time off on your birthday, and many other perks we’ll share when we meet!


Are you ready to help us revolutionize financial well-being for all?


Apply today, and let’s build something amazing together. We believe that innovation thrives in person, so we work from the office four days a week to foster collaboration and creativity.

*Please note that we are not offering relocation support for this position.*

***PS: During the holiday season things will slow down so be patient with us and we will be getting back to everyone applying as soon as we possibly can once we are back.***
company_description: We're the rebels of the financial industry, putting an end to overpriced financial products. We push the envelope of fintech and financial health!

title: Business Developer (Founder's associate)
description:
We are the leading European open finance company with high growth ambitions. We give consumers access to a broad set of financial data from multiple sources, including banks and insurers, so consumers can actually understand it and use it. Our products turn complex financial data into something simple, clear, and actionable. Our mission is to power the next generation of financial services.


We sell to banks and insurance companies and already work with paying customers in the Nordics and in France, with a clear focus on further international expansion.

### **Role**


We are looking for a hands-on generalist who wants to work close to our founders and leadership team and grow quickly through real responsibility. This is a practical role for someone who enjoys variety, takes ownership, and is comfortable operating when things are not fully defined.


You will support the founders and leadership team across many different types of work. One week you might analyze numbers or prepare material for investors. Another week you might drive an internal project, structure a messy problem, or help ensure execution happens across teams.


This is not a role with a fixed task list, but you will always have context, clear priorities, and access to support when you need it. You are expected to figure out the how and deliver, with the team around you.

### **What you will learn**

* How founders think, prioritize, and make decisions
* How a B2B fintech company works with banks and insurers
* How growth, fundraising, and execution actually happen
* How to operate when both speed and quality matter
* And much more!

### **What you will do**

* Act as an extra brain and pair of hands to founders and leadership
* Take ownership of ad hoc tasks and drive them to completion
* Analyze data and turn insights into clear recommendations
* Prepare presentations, briefs, and decision material
* Coordinate and follow up cross-functional initiatives
* Step into whatever is most important for the company right now


Some work will be strategic and some will be very practical. Both are equally important.

### **Who you are**

* You have 2-3+ years of work experience
* You have worked in a startup, consulting, or another high-paced environment
* You are analytical and structured, without overcomplicating things
* You are comfortable operating with imperfect information
* You take ownership of your work and are comfortable driving things forward independently, while asking for input when needed
* You are fluent in English. French is a bonus, not a requirement


You do not need to tick every box to apply. If this role sounds exciting and you think you could grow into it, we encourage you to apply.

### **Practical details**


We are centrally located at Kungsgatan 9, Stockholm.


If you want to learn fast, take real responsibility, and help build a company with international ambition, we would love to hear from you!

title: Android Developer
description:
**At Hemnet, you’ll join a small, supportive Android community that thrives on collaboration and continuous learning. We work with a modern Android stack and give the freedom to introduce the latest improvements in Android development to the project. Whether you’re passionate about UX, app architecture, or improving developer tooling, there’s room to grow and specialise in what you enjoy working on.**


As an Android Developer, you will work in one of our product development teams as well as playing a big role in our App community consisting of 7 Android Developers and 11 iOS Developers working daily in creating a crisp and delightful UI for our users.  

  

You will join our Account team which is at the heart of Hemnet’s personalized experience, with the mission to guide users to relevant personalized content and to unify user identity and CRM to enable cohesive and personalized communication.You will contribute to all stages in the product life cycle: design, implementation, testing, deployment and maintenance. Together with us you will have the ability to create a big impact on what we build and how we build it, as each team is in control of their own product decisions.


We work with a data-driven approach in close collaboration with each other - exploring, testing and iterating. Thanks to our large amount of traffic, we quickly validate against real data and learn from new insights.  

  

**What you will do**

* Create high-quality and robust features, owning the development process from planning to final delivery and follow up.
* Work closely with passionate and experienced product managers, designers, and other engineers with different backgrounds to plan and ensure high-quality results.
* Be an active participant in the App Community and wider product development team at Hemnet.
* Proactively improve the product by fixing, maintaining, organising and automating.

**Who are you?**  

To become successful in this position you are reasonably up to date with the latest Android coding standards and are excited to keep up to date with the latest Android technologies**.**You also enjoy knowledge sharing and learning together, putting extra effort into code reviews (which also makes work more fun). With an eye for design, you always strive to create simple and easy-to-understand solutions. You have experience working with consumer facing apps focusing on external users. We also believe you have worked with different kinds of release processes and truly believe in the value of automated testing.  

  

**Here’s a peek at our stack**  

Kotlin  

Jetpack Compose  

Coroutines and Flow  

Git  

Unidirectional Data Flow architecture (UDF)  

Compose navigation  

UI, Compose and unit tests  

Continuous Integration  

  

**I’m your new manager**  

Hi! My name is Staffan, and I’ll be your new manager. I’ve been at Hemnet since 2019 but just recently joined our domain called Consumers. I’m really excited to support the teams that will be working on many new and important areas for Hemnet – including personalization and smarter search features.


My leadership style is listening, transparent, accessible, and supportive, while also challenging you to take your next step. Hopefully, we’ll learn a lot from each other and have plenty of fun as we break new ground at Hemnet. As a team, we get things done; we know when and where value can be added, and we’re clear on our priorities.


Why did I decide to join Hemnet? I was strongly drawn to the culture and atmosphere – a wonderful combination of kindness, inclusiveness, and helpfulness, paired with high ambitions and a strong drive forward. My impression is that the people and the workplace together create the perfect foundation for you to do the best work of your career.


At Hemnet, we believe tech is better when built together. If you want to shape not only code but also the future of Sweden’s most loved housing platform, we’d love to hear from you.  

  

**A Note on Inclusion**  

At Hemnet, we believe that diversity in gender, sexual orientation, ability, neurodiversity, cultural background and life experience makes us stronger. We welcome applicants of all identities and backgrounds.  

If you meet many but not all of the requirements, we encourage you to apply. We value curiosity, a strong sense of purpose and the motivation to learn and grow, alongside your skills and experiences.  

  

**Your career at Hemnet**  

With over 40 million visits each month, you’ll be part of Sweden’s most popular property platform – and one of the world’s most admired real estate platforms. But our size and reputation aren’t the only reasons why you and your 150+ colleagues enjoy working here.


Since 1998, Hemnet has been an essential go-to place for millions of Swedes, guiding them through one of life’s biggest transitions: finding a new place to call home. We’re proud to make this life-changing, often stressful journey as seamless as possible.


With access to vast amounts of data, you’ll have limitless opportunities to explore and create new features that enhance the experience for Sweden’s real estate agents, home buyers, and sellers.  

  

Our friendly Hemnet culture fosters a dynamic, playful environment where every voice is valued. Here, you’ll join a welcoming team that encourages you to thrive and grow, working alongside passionate colleagues from around the world.

 **A Hybrid Way of Working**
  

Our vibrant office in central Stockholm is the hub of our collaboration and culture, providing a lively space that fosters team spirit. We come together in the office three days a week, with two flexible remote days. To be part of our team, it’s essential to be based in or near Stockholm.
company_description: At Hemnet we help people find their dream homes.

title: Senior Ignition Developer till TechSeed
description:
*På TechSeed är vi övertygade om att det är tekniken som kommer göra världen till en bättre plats. Vi ser ett stort behov i vårt samhälle att kombinera affärsförståelse, digitalt ledarskap samt innovativa arbetssätt och lösningar med framtidens tekniker i uppkopplade ekosystem. Vi tror på en hållbar framtid med säkra lösningar genom exempelvis IoT-lösningar, digitala tvillingar, AI och cybersäkerhet. Det här är vårt WHY och det fyller oss med energi varje dag. Det här är vår arena.*


TechSeed är ett medarbetarägt bolag som erbjuder konsulttjänster och har ett kompetensdjup inom flera domäner. Vi är på en kraftig tillväxtresa och söker nu en **IIoT Software Consultant** med fokus på **Ignition** som även kommer få en stor grad av inflytande och insyn i hur vi växer framåt och tar ett helhetsgrepp om uppkopplade ekosystem och lösningar. Vi söker dig som trivs i konsultrollen och samtidigt vill bidra till att skapa vägen framåt för TechSeed – Tillsammans.


Verktygen för att koppla upp industrin blir fler och vi på TechSeed har ett flertal partnerskap för de främsta plattformarna på marknaden, däribland Ignition. I denna roll kommer du arbeta med dessa plattformar hos våra kunder för att implementera och förbättra IoT-lösningar. Du kommer vara en viktig del i vår satsning på industriella smarta lösningar, ett område i TechSeeds absoluta kärna, och ha stora möjligheter att vara med och forma hur vi arbetar med dessa områden framåt.


I den här rollen kommer du tillhöra enheten **Edge & IoT.** Vi är en nyckelpartner för våra kunders IIoT/IoT-resa där vi med hjälp en kompetens inom utveckling, IoT-arkitektur, leverans och affärsrådgivning hjälper våra kunder att konfigurera, utveckla och skräddarsy IoT-lösningar och applikationstjänster som passar kundens behov.

**Vem söker vi?**


Vi söker dig som är driven, har lätt att knyta kontakter och snabbt förstår utmaningar du ställs inför. Du har mycket goda kunskaper inom utveckling i Ignition och de relevanta kompetenser som krävs för det, samt erfarenhet från industriell produktion och lösningar som MES/SCADA. Denna roll är en konsultroll och därför söker vi dig som trivs i den rollen och som är obehindrad i både svenska och engelska, tal och skrift


Om du är intresserad finns även möjligheten att lära dig våra andra system som Insights Hub, Industrial Edge och Building X.

title: Fullstack Javautvecklare (Hyrköp)
description:
**Professional Galaxy** är ett IT och teknikkonsultbolag som tillhandahåller högspecialiserad kompetens inom IT, utveckling, elektronik och mekanik konstruktion. Vi arbetar med seniora experter och levererar strategiskt värdeskapande kompetens till några av Sveriges mest komplexa och samhällskritiska projekt. Vårt fokus ligger alltid på hög kvalitet, professionalism och mätbara resultat.


Är du rätt person för uppdraget, eller vill du rekommendera en stark kandidat? Tveka inte att kontakta oss.


Ansök gärna redan idag – urval och intervjuer sker löpande.


Professional Galaxy söker en **Fullstack Javautvecklare (Hyrköp)** på uppdrag av vår klient.


Vill du utvecklas i en modern FinTech-miljö och samtidigt få chansen att bli anställd efter uppdraget? Nu söker vi utvecklare med 3+ års erfarenhet som vill växa vidare i ett tvärfunktionellt team och arbeta i en teknikstack som kombinerar Java, React och moderna mikrotjänster. Uppdraget startar som konsult i 12 månader, med krav på överrekrytering till därefter.

**Krav**  

* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling.
* Goda kunskaper i Java.
* Erfarenhet av React och TypeScript.
* Förståelse för fullstack-arbete och moderna webbtjänster.
* Vilja och möjlighet att gå över till anställning på Företag efter uppdraget.
**Meriterande**  

* Erfarenhet av Kotlin (starkt meriterande).
* Kunskap om microservices, REST, SQL eller Kafka.
* Vana att arbeta i produktnära agila team.
**Uppdraget**  

* Bidra som utvecklare i ett växande team inom företag Financial Services.
* Arbeta med utveckling av skalbara fintech-lösningar i nära samarbete med produkt och design.
* Delta i nyutveckling, förbättringar och vidareutveckling av tjänster som används av företagare i hela Sverige.
**Villkor för underkonsult**  

F-skatt och ansvarsförsäkring krävs. Kunden står för utrustning. Tidrapportering månadsvis. Fakturering en gång per månad, med 35 dagars betalvillkor. Sekretessavtal tecknas innan start. Efter 12 månader sker överrekrytering till Företag enligt hyrköpsupplägget**.**

**Övrig information**  

**Arbetsmodell:** på plats initialt, därefter hybrid  

**Möjlighet till förlängning:** Ja  

**Uppdragsperiod:** 2026-02-02 - 2027-02-01

* **Längd:** 12 månader, med krav på överrekrytering till (hyrköp)
* **Omfattning:** 100%
* **Start:** ASAP
* **Techstack:** Java, React/TypeScript
* **Språk:** Svenska + engelska

**Sista ansökningsdag:** 2026-01-30


Ansök genom att bifoga ditt CV (vi vill inte ha något personligt brev) och besvara urvalsfrågorna. Frågorna utgår från kravprofilen för den här rekryteringen och dina svar ligger till grund för det urval som sker i processen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.  

  

Vänligen notera att krav och eventuella meriter ska vara uppfyllda vid ansökningstillfället.

title: Product Developer
description:
**Would you like to take Lundhags products to next level?**


Lundhags is searching for a skilled and detail-oriented Product Developer to strengthening the team in Stockholm.


By utilizing over 90 years of craftsmanship from Jämtland, Sweden, Lundhags develops uncompromising, modern outdoor gear that endures for generations.


Lundhags produce Footwear, Apparel and Packs for Active outdoor life and has recently embarked on an exciting journey to strengthen the brand and it’s product offer. If you are motivated by impeccable products, outdoor life and working in a forward leaning team this could be for you.


Lundhags is a part of Brav. Brav is a major player in the sports and outdoor industry and manages some of the most influential brands in the marketplace, including Swix, Toko, Lundhags, Ulvang, and Helsport. Brav has offices and own companies in Norway, Sweden, Finland, Switzerland, Germany, Lithuania, Japan and the United States. Our products are sold in more than 30 countries worldwide.


**About the role**


In this role you are managing Product-, and Material development for Lundhags Apparel. You work close with design and product management to build a consumer relevant, efficient and profitable product range. You are in daily contact with garment vendors and lead the work towards fabric suppliers. You report to the Sourcing Manager.

**Your main areas of responsibility are:**

* Product development of Lundhags Apparel in alignment with strategy and timelines
* Build and maintain a strong and successful relation to our vendors to achieve high quality products
* Own the relation with our fabric suppliers and drive material development
* Secure satisfying cost of product
* Secure product quality

**Who you are:**

* You live an active outdoor life often beyond the city boarders and know what is required from durable outdoor apparel
* You are well organized and proactive
* You are solution oriented and brings an energizing and positive mindset to the team.
* You are self propelled with strong ownership of your tasks
* You have deep knowledge of the product development process of Apparel products
* You have high standards
* You have good knowledge of product cost and have good track record of price negotiations
* You have good knowledge of functional materials for outdoor use
* You are motivated by driving change

**Requested experiences**

* A bachelor degree in relevant area ( Textile/Fashion business-, engineering-, design or similar)
* Min 5 years of Product development of high quality garments, Experience from developing performance products highly meriting.
* A good understanding for what makes outdoor gear great through previous work or passion
* Very good communication skills in English
* Experienced in digital tools as Microsoft office and PLM

**Why work at Lundhags?**


At Lundhags, you become part of a brand built on craftsmanship, heritage, and a philosophy centered on life in nature. You join a passionate team and get the opportunity to truly influence the brands’s performance, culture, and customer experience. You will have strong opportunities to grow and to take the store to the next level.


At Brav, we are committed to promoting a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace. We believe that diversity in backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences strengthens our organization and ultimately benefits our employees, customers, and communities. We actively seek candidates from all backgrounds to join us in our mission to create the best foundation for our customers’ outdoor experiences. We encourage individuals of all ethnicities, genders, ages, abilities, and backgrounds to apply.

**Deadline for application Jan 14th 2026.**  

  

If critical questions please contact Mija.Nideborn@brav.com . Pleases note that responses will be limited over the Holidays.

title: Back-End Developer – Identity & Access Management (IAM)
description:
Millions of people rely on Clavister every day for secure login and management of their digital identities. Our Identity & Access Management (IAM) solutions play a vital role in securing digital services used across both the public and private sector. We are now looking for an experienced Back-End Developer to be part of the ongoing development of our cutting-edge IAM solutions.


Do you want to contribute to technology that protects critical services and supports a secure digital society?

**About Clavister**


Clavister is a Swedish cybersecurity company with a comprehensive portfolio spanning network security, identity and access management, and cloud security. Our solutions are used globally to protect critical infrastructure, public authorities and enterprises.


Within Clavister’s broader cybersecurity offering, our IAM solutions focus on secure authentication, authorisation and identity management, enabling organisations to protect users, systems and digital services in complex environments.

**About the role**


As a Back-End Developer at Clavister, you will work in a skilled and solution-oriented development team dedicated to our IAM products. These products handle thousands of users daily and are deployed in both public and private sector environments.


You will contribute to the continued development and evolution of our IAM solutions, with a strong focus on reliability, security and performance. The role involves close collaboration with colleagues in engineering, product management and customer success (application experts) teams.

**Your responsibilities**

* Design, develop and maintain Java-based server-side software in Clavister’s IAM products
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to improve product quality and customer value
* Contribute to identifying and addressing technical debt in the software
* Contribute to a strong and sustainable engineering culture

**Your profile**


We believe you have several years of experience in back-end development and solid knowledge of server-side software development. You are self-driven, curious and comfortable taking ownership of your work. You enjoy solving complex problems and working closely with others in a collaborative environment.

**Required skills**

* Strong experience with Java and the Java ecosystem
* Experience developing asynchronous code
* Working knowledge of SQL
* Experience with Docker
* Familiarity with Windows and Linux environments
* Professional working proficiency in English

**An extra plus**

* Experience with other Identity & Access Management (IAM) solutions - either as developer or application expert/administrator
* Experience of Front-end development using HTML, CSS, JavaScript/TypeScript and React
* Experience designing and building complex systems

**What we offer**

* The opportunity to work with IAM solutions that are part of a broader, leading cybersecurity portfolio
* A collaborative and knowledgeable team where we support and learn from each other
* A culture that values work–life balance and long-term sustainability
* A growing company where you can develop both professionally and personally

**Practical information**


The position is based in Stockholm. We review applications continuously, so please apply as soon as possible.


For more information about the role, please contact the hiring manager at lars.bjorkman@clavister.com.

title: FW Developer
description:
**Embedded Software Engineer – Wireless Access & IoT**


**Build the Future of Wireless Access with Us**  

**Location:** Stockholm, Sweden  

Hybrid Digital & Access Solutions EMEIA

  



Embedded systems shape how people move, work and feel secure — and so will you.  

As an **Embedded Software Engineer** in our Wireless Lock product unit, you help bring **APERIO®**, our world-leading wireless access platform, to life. The firmware you build runs in real products used in hospitals, universities, workplaces and public buildings.



If you want a role where technical depth meets purpose — and where secure, low-power, connected devices are your playground — this is where your impact becomes visible.

  


**Your Role**



You’ll work hands-on with the firmware that powers our wireless locks and influence how they perform, connect and evolve.

  


**Design, Build, Deliver**


* Develop reliable, secure firmware for wireless, battery-powered locks
* Implement features on ARM Cortex MCUs (M0–M4) using C
* Debug at a low level using oscilloscopes, logic analysers and hardware tools

  


**Engineer for a Connected World**


* Work across RTOS and bare-metal environments
* Apply modern embedded practices, including CI/CD and automated testing
* Improve system performance, stability and long-term efficiency

  


**Advance Wireless Access Technology**
* Enhance connectivity features (BLE, Zigbee, NFC/ISO14443, UWB) and low-power performance
* Bring insights from IoT trends, cybersecurity and standards into development

  


**What You Bring**


* Strong skills in embedded C development on ARM Cortex MCUs
* Ability to debug deeply using hardware tools
* Experience with RTOS or bare-metal environments
* Familiarity with CI/CD and structured development practices
* Clear communication and a collaborative, solutions-focused mindset

  


**Nice to have / keen to develop:** BLE/Zigbee, low-power design, credential technologies or IoT security trends.

  


**What You Gain by Joining Us**

  


**Work That Matters**



Your firmware helps secure thousands of buildings worldwide and makes daily life safer and more accessible.

  


**Autonomy in Action**



Your expertise is trusted. You’ll influence architecture, explore new ideas and shape how our wireless locks evolve.

  


**Growth with Purpose**



Whether you want to deepen your embedded skills, explore wireless protocols or grow into technical leadership, we support your development.

  


**A Culture That Backs You**



Our team works on site most of the time – and it’s one of our strengths. As an embedded engineer, being close to hardware, test rigs and your colleagues make a real difference. Working together accelerates debugging, shortens testing loops and gives you the fast problem-solving environment that embedded development benefits from. You feel the energy, the collaboration and the impact of your work every day.

  


**Ready to Build Technology That Protects the World?**

  



If you want to grow within a team that values innovation, craftsmanship and the power of connected devices — we want to meet you.  

**Apply today. Bring your expertise. Shape our future.**



We review applications continuously, so don’t wait.  

We’re committed to building diverse, inclusive teams and encourage applications from all who see themselves thriving here.



To make sure your personal data stays protected, we do not review applications sent via email or post.  

If you have questions about the role or process, contact Léa Rein, Senior Talent Acquisition Business Partner.


**Let’s create a safer and more open world — together.**

  


**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**  

Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.
company_description: Let’s create a safer and more open world – together!

title: Front-end Developer
description:
**Looking for a workplace for the future?**
 At Telenor, you own your career. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to make the most of your dreams and expertise while contributing to technological innovations that are barely even imagined today. Innovations that we know will change the map for how we communicate and live our connected lives in the future. Are you looking for a workplace where you can make a difference in what matters most – relationships between people.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 As a Front-end Developer at Telenor, you will play a key role in building and enhancing our consumer-facing products. You’ll work across the frontend and backend to deliver seamless solutions, collaborating with other cross-functional teams to support our sales channels. Beyond development, you’ll take ownership of deployment and operations with a strong DevOps mindset—ensuring our applications are accessible, high-performing, and built to the highest quality standards.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Build reusable code and libraries with high quality
* Performance optimization and accessibility compliance


**Who You Are**
 You are an experienced software developer with a deep understanding of custom-built applications and strong expertise in Front-end, headless CMS. Preferably also with experience in .Net and Cloud native solutions.
   

  

**Behaviors**
 You are proactive and take ownership of your work, always looking for ways to improve solutions and optimize performance. You lead by example, ensuring best practices and high standards across the team. You follow through on commitments, fostering reliability and trust. Above all, you act with integrity and respect, creating a culture of collaboration and transparency.
   

  

**Skills**
* Deep expertise in Front-end, preferable Vue.js and Vue 3.
* Hands-on experience with CMS
* Understanding of RESTful APIs, microservices architecture, and event-driven systems
* Experience with cloud platforms (preferably AWS) and DevOps practices and tooling. Proficiency in database design (SQL and NoSQL), caching strategies, and performance tuning
* Strong security mindset, with knowledge of authentication, authorization, and data protection best practices


**Soft Skills**
* Critical thinker and problem solver, able to navigate trade-offs between short-term deliverables and long-term system health
* Strong communication skills, capable of explaining complex problems to developers, architects, and business stakeholders
* Self-motivated and adaptable, embracing change and fostering continuous learning within the team


**Our promise to you**
**We are better together.**
 Here, you’ll be part of a collaborative and inclusive culture, built on strong shared values and leadership that empowers you with both trust and confidence. We believe in enabling each other to act and make decisions, while always having each other’s backs through ups and downs.
   

  

**We support relationships and societies.**
 Telenor plays a vital role in the society, giving your work a greater purpose. Every day, we create value for millions of people and maintain a customer-first approach where human relationships are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

**We make room for life.**
 Work from home up to two days a week, where your role allows it. The rest of the time, we create magic together at the office. You also get two ‘give-me-a-break’ days per year for extra time off, and our flexible working hours help you balance your time. We also support you through every stage of life with our benefits package.
   

  

**We invite you to a career in motion.**
 Your development is at the center of our culture. We dedicate at least 40 hours per year for you to deepen your expertise, explore new areas, and develop in your role. Through Telenor Academy and other learning initiatives, you’ll have the tools and freedom to advance your career. When you want to broaden your horizons, we are present throughout the Nordics.
   

  

**Apply today!**
 Experience Telenor through the eyes of one of our team members – authentic and inspiring.
   

  

 https://player.gobistories.com/8vue8
   

  

 Will you take the next step in your career with us? We look forward to your application! We review applicants on an ongoing basis, so don’t wait—reach out today.
   

  

**Good to know**
 As part of Telenor’s policy, we conduct background checks on final candidates for all recruitments.

title: Software Engineer
description:
*Vi söker för närvarande erfarna mjukvaruutvecklare till vår utvecklingsavdelning inom marin mjukvara för framtidens försvar, mer specifikt vår framgångsrika produkt – 9LV CMS. Vi hanterar alla aspekter av utveckling från grunden – från plattformslösningar till användargränsytor.*
*Vill du ha flertalet kontaktytor mot teknisk expertis i våra olika kundprojekt och med en touch av engelska? Då har du precis hittat rätt!*
**Din roll**
 Våra mjukvaru-team ansvarar autonomt för sin kravhantering, design, implementation och test av mjukvara samt all detaljplanering som rör funktionen i de marina ledningssystemen. Våra kundprojekt ansvarar för att varje fartygsklass får ett system som är skräddarsytt efter deras behov.
   

  

 Vi behöver nu växa ytterligare i följande kompetensområden:
   

  

* Sensorer, simulatorer och vapenapplikationer – Applikationsutveckling, Java, C++, Ada, Docker, Git, JIRA i både Linux och Windows baserade miljöer
+ Meriterande: Erfarenhet av att hantera transformation av video strömmar från råa format till komprimerade format och vice versa


 Som mjukvaruutvecklare arbetar du med att leverera beställd funktionalitet, i rätt tid och till överenskommen budget. Det betyder att du kommer att arbeta praktiskt i teamets backlog för både sprint- och kvartalsplaneringar.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Vi tror att du har arbetat med mjukvaruutveckling i minst 10 år och nu känner dig redo för att testa en ny aspekt av mjukvaruutveckling. Du är intresserad av att bidra till det gemensamma genom att kommunicera med alla, från andra utvecklare, scrum masters och produktägare till kundprojektledare. Vi tror därför att du har ett samarbetstänkande där du kan se saker ur olika perspektiv som också uppmuntrar till ett öppet, förtroendefullt och innovativt klimat. Som person är du verkligen en doer, villig att lösa alla problem som behövs för att hjälpa organisationen att klara sina leveranser. Du har förmågan att kommunicera obehindrat på svenska och engelska, såväl i tal som skrift.
   

  

*Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.*
**Vad du blir en del av**
 Upptäck oändliga möjligheter. Anta utmaningar, skapa smarta innovationer och uppgradera dina förmågor. Det här är en plats för kluriga tänkare, modiga pionjärer och alla däremellan. Tillsammans uppnår vi det extraordinära, var och en tar med sitt unika perspektiv. Varje bidrag räknas.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen.
   

  

 Med 26 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem.
   

  

 Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga.

title: Fullstack Engineer - Integrations Team
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

 Mentimeter serves hundreds of millions of users with services that we deploy roughly 40 times a week. With transaction loads up to hundreds of votes per second, we have to be sure we can scale while still delivering a fast and smooth experience.
   

  

 We work in small, independent, cross-functional and self-organizing teams. The team’s product manager and the team work together to organize and plan the team’s backlog with a focus on continuously delivering value to our users.
   

  

 Please note that we are an English-first company, meaning you don’t have to know Swedish to work here. Make sure your application and relevant documents are in English.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 You'll be joining our Workplace Integrations team - a newly formed team focused on building the bridges that make Mentimeter indispensable within existing workplace ecosystems. We enable strategic integrations with platforms like Microsoft Teams, and Google Workspace that unlock value for both end users and enterprises, turning every integration into an opportunity for organizational growth.
   

  

 On the Workplace Integrations team specifically, you'll design and build scalable integration architectures connecting Mentimeter with integrations that are the fabric of how companies operate. You'll ensure our integrations meet enterprise requirements for security, compliance, and reliability, while building monitoring systems to maintain high availability. You'll also create developer-friendly documentation and balance technical decisions that serve both immediate user needs and long-term scalability.
   

  

 As a member of the team you’ll contribute to strategic decisions about future integrations - building deep domain knowledge about the workplace ecosystem and contributing insights on which platforms will drive the most value for our users and business. You will do this with other engineers, a Product Manager, a Product Designer, and an Engineering Manager. Even though there are some specific roles in the team, we do things and solve problems together. We want you to be someone who engages with the rest of the team in product and design decisions and doesn't shy away from discussions.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You are a reliable, high-performing individual contributor with a solid understanding of your area of specialization. You always have a good idea of what you want to do and then just do it. You embrace change and short feedback loops.
   

  

 In addition to living up to our cultural values (see our
 **Culture at Mentimeter** 
 section below), we hope you bring a passion for software development, scalable architecture, and building great products. For us, it is important that everyone cares about code quality, so an interest in testing and automation is needed. Excellent communication skills and working independently and in a team are other traits we are looking for in all our colleagues.
   

  

 For the Workplace Integrations team, experience building integrations with third-party platforms or working extensively with external APIs is valuable. You should understand the complexities of distributed systems and async workflows, feel comfortable navigating technical documentation from various vendors, and have a security-first mindset, especially in enterprise contexts. You can balance perfectionism with pragmatism and are excited by making complex technical systems feel simple to end users.
   

  

 Last but not least, you must have a curious mindset, be open to learning & sharing knowledge, and be interested in working with our tech stack.
   

  

**The actual coding**
 The Tech Stack At Mentimeter Consists Of a Frontend Written In React (Next.js And Typescript), And a Backend Written In Ruby (not Rails). Supported By Some Of The Following Technologies
   

  

* Tailwind CSS
* Node.js
* Redis
* PostgreSQL
* Cloudflare
* AWS


 On the Workplace Integrations team, you'll also work with various third-party APIs and SDKs (Microsoft Graph, Slack, Google Workspace), OAuth 2.0 and other authentication protocols, webhook systems and event-driven architectures, and message queues for reliable async processing.
   

  

 We require someone who knows React well but not necessarily Ruby for this role. If you know Ruby, that's great, but knowing another backend language well and being willing to learn Ruby is equally fine. It's more important to us that you have the right attitude than the exact right skill set.
   

  

**Our Recruitment Process**
* Introduction call


 Get to know us better and introduce yourself further.
   

  

* Meet the hiring manager


 Get to know the team scope and role expectations
   

  

* Culture interview


 Discuss our company culture and core values
   

  

* Technical competence interview


 Show your skills by conducting a technical system design case with other engineers onsite.
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**AI and Hiring at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter, we believe AI helps us work smarter - but it never replaces the human assessment, curiosity, and personal connection that define our culture and our hiring. We use AI as a sparring partner: to bounce ideas, bring new perspectives, support structure, and make our work more efficient. But the meaning, decisions, and interactions always come from people.
   

  

* AI does not screen or decide on candidates.
* There is no automated filtering, ranking, or decision-making in our recruitment process. Every application is reviewed by a person.
* Hiring teams may use AI to support their work - for example, to structure notes, prepare interview questions, or organize their thinking.


 AI strengthens our work, but it does not define it. At Mentimeter, we’re not building an AI-driven hiring process - we’re building a people-first culture, where technology helps us listen, learn, and grow together.
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Senior Fullstack Javascript Developer
description:
**About Anyfin**
 At Anyfin, we believe in simplicity, transparency, and fairness. We’re the fintech on a mission to challenge the status quo, lowering interest rates, removing unnecessary fees, and helping people take control of their finances.
   

  

 With more than a million app downloads and presence in Sweden, Norway, Finland, and Germany, we’ve already helped hundreds of thousands of people save money and feel more financially empowered.
   

  

 We recently obtained our banking license, opening up an entirely new world of opportunities to provide more value to our customers, build even smarter products, scale our technology, and expand into new markets. This next chapter comes with exciting technical challenges — and we’re looking for someone who’s eager to take them on.
   

  

 The role
   

  

 As a Senior Fullstack Developer At Anyfin, You’ll Play a Key Part In Shaping The Future Of Our Products, From Concept To Launch. You’ll
   

  

* Work across the stack, mainly using Typescript, Node.js, React, and React Native.
* Take end-to-end ownership of features and projects: backend architecture, APIs, data models, frontend, mobile apps, deployment, and operations.
* Help drive improvements across our codebase, processes, and product, bringing that startup mindset where you take initiative, move fast, and get things done.
* Balance speed with quality, because we care about building things that last and seeing our work make a real difference for our users.
* Contribute to our mission to make finances fairer and empower people to make better financial decisions.


 What we’re looking for
   

  

* At least 5 years of professional experience in TypeScript development, across both frontend and backend.
* Hands-on experience with Node.js, React, React Native, or similar frameworks and an ability to handle complexity, scalability, and user-centered design.
* Solid understanding of databases, API design, testing, CI/CD, and cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, or similar).
* A problem-solver who takes ownership, speaks up, and helps the team and product move forward.
* Comfortable in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment where change is part of the fun.


 We offer
   

  

 A meaningful role where your work directly impacts how people experience and manage their finances.
   

  

 The chance to work alongside talented engineers, product managers, and designers with real influence on the product direction.
   

  

 A culture built on authenticity, ownership, transparency, and having fun while doing impactful work.
   

  

 Why Anyfin?
   

  

 At Anyfin, you’ll find a team driven by purpose, curiosity, and a shared ambition to make a difference. We promise a challenging and rewarding journey that will sharpen your skills, expand your creativity, and allow you to work on meaningful projects. Plus, enjoy the benefits of a centrally-located Stockholm office, competitive compensation, extra time off on your birthday, and many other perks we’ll share when we meet!
   

  

 Are you ready to help us revolutionize financial well-being for all?
   

  

 Apply today, and let’s build something amazing together. We believe that innovation thrives in person, so we work from the office four days a week to foster collaboration and creativity.
   

  

*Please note that we are not offering relocation support for this position.*
***PS: During the holiday season things will slow down so be patient with us and we will be getting back to everyone applying as soon as we possibly can once we are back.***
 Anyfin is a fintech on a mission to simplify loan repayments and improve the financial well-being of millions. We help consumers reduce the costs of high-interest loans, and take control of their repayment plan.

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Join the planet’s most important fight**
**Normative is now looking for a Software Engineer for our team in Stockholm**
 At Normative, we're on a mission to accelerate the transition to a net-zero world. We provide science-based carbon accounting software and tailored advice from net-zero experts, empowering companies to reduce their carbon footprints.
   

  

 We’re now looking for a Software Engineer to strengthen our R&D team. You’ll be part of a group of curious and driven engineers who combine solid backend craft with data-driven thinking, building the services that make climate impact visible and actionable.
   

  

**What you will do:**
 As a Software Engineer at Normative you will:
   

  

* Build and evolve our Python-based backend services
* Work with databases and APIs that handle complex sustainability data
* Collaborate closely with Sustainability Engineers, product managers, and frontend engineers to deliver features end-to-end
* Contribute to improving how we build software, from CI/CD pipelines to testing and monitoring


 In addition, you’ll have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Shape how we combine software engineering and sustainability in a fast-growing domain
* Take ownership of technical decisions and drive them forward together with your team
* Learn and share knowledge in an environment that values collaboration and growth


**Experience we’re seeking:**
 We think you’ll thrive in this role if you have:
   

  

* Solid experience working with Python in a production setting
* A good understanding of web services and databases
* Curiosity about data and a willingness to work with the Python data stack
* A proactive and collaborative mindset


 It’s also a bonus if you bring
   

  

* Exposure to Typescript or frontend development
* Familiarity with cloud platforms and containerization
* Experience from data-heavy products or sustainability tech
* A love for learning and sharing knowledge with others


**Location**
 Normative has offices in Stockholm, London and Copenhagen. For this role you will be located in our office in Copenhagen.
   

  

*At this time we are not able to offer relocation or VISA support for this position.*
**Benefits**
* Market-based salaries and annual merit-based salary reviews
* 30 days/year of paid vacation + up to 2 additional days off
* Pension and parental leave
* 5,000 SEK wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag) + 1 wellness hour per week
* Social and team-building activities (off-site, after work, winter/summer parties)
* An opportunity to make a real positive impact on the world
* A friendly, supportive and humble working culture


*We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time*
**How To Apply**
 We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.
   

  

**Our interview process consists of 4 stages:**
* Screening interview with a member of our Talent Acquisition team
* First interview with the hiring manager
* Practical Care Interview
* Values interview


 We’re committed to hiring diversely. Having employees from diverse backgrounds brings a wealth of perspectives and experience to our team. We assess candidates based on their experience, skills and unique talents and evaluate everyone against the same criteria.
   

  

*Normative handles sensitive financial data and we will therefore conduct a background check before hiring any candidate.*

title: Pega developer (banking)
description:
At Capgemini, you’ll have the opportunity to shape your career in a way that suits you, supported by a global community of experts who inspire and empower you. We believe in reimagining what’s possible - using technology to build a more sustainable, inclusive world. Our Financial Services team is at the forefront of this mission. As a reliable partner we guide our customers such as major banks and insurance companies with everything from strategy and planning to implementation and management.
   

  

**Your role**
 Working with experienced colleagues, you will assist our customers from early-stage advice to the implementation and integration of the multifaceted platform Pega. Depending on your experience and background, you will have various opportunities and roles in Pega projects. Our projects enhance customer experiences, create customer journeys, and bring them to life with agile teams. We establish new digital platforms and streamline work processes with digital solutions.
   

  

*In this position you will play a key role in:*
* Designing and developing Pega applications to automate banking processes.
* Translating business requirements into effective Pega solutions.
* Customizing and configuring Pega systems to meet specific project needs.
* Providing ongoing maintenance and support for existing Pega applications.


**Your profile**
* Experience from Pega, either from a position as a developer or system architect.
* Experience in working in an agile and test-driven environment.
* Previous consulting or client service delivery experience.
* One or more certifications in SA, SSA or LSA.
* Proficiency in Swedish is a plus and candidates based in Sweden will be prioritized.
* Experience in financial services or the insurance industry is beneficial.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* You get to work with major customers within banking and insurance, in exciting and varied roles, giving you the opportunity to develop both personally and professionally.
* The freedom to make decisions, manage your time, and work independently - fostering creativity, innovation, and job satisfaction.
* An extensive benefits package, including parental benefits, occupational and flex pension, private insurance, preventive healthcare, and more.
* A variety of social and wellness activities, from sports and health programs to cultural events and art initiatives, designed to bring employees together and enrich work life.


*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification and background checks may occasionally be conducted. More information will be provided if applicable.*
*We’re in the midst of the holiday season and we hope you’re having a pleasant end of the year! We’ll start reviewing applications during January and look forward to possibly connecting with you soon!*
**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is an AI-powered global business and technology transformation partner, delivering tangible business value. We imagine the future of organizations and make it real with AI, technology and people. With our strong heritage of nearly 60 years, we are a responsible and diverse group of 420,000 team members in more than 50 countries. We deliver end-to-end services and solutions with our deep industry expertise and strong partner ecosystem, leveraging our capabilities across strategy, technology, design, engineering and business operations. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Make it real |** 
**www.capgemini.com**

title: Embedded System Architect
description:
Swedium Global is the growing System Engineering and Solution Company, offers services like Semiconductor Engineering R&D Services, Embedded Systems Development, Custom Application Software Development, Web and Cloud Application Development, Testing Services, Consultancy and Outsourcing services to our clients across the globe for an onsite and offshore business model.
